Package renderer

Class Render

java.lang.Object
renderer.Render
public class Render
extends java.lang.Object
render - calculates and makes the picture to happen

      Parameters:
      numOfRays_inBeam -

    • renderImage

      public void renderImage()
      gets and collects all the data, and for every pixel sets the color. Filling the buffer according to the geometries that are in the scene. This function does not creating the picture file, but create the buffer pf pixels after refactoring -this func includes multiply choices 1.with or without "super sampling" - for the costumer's choice. 2.the number of threads that will run - if 1 - just like before the refactoring. if more - with all the thread's addition 3.the number of ray in a beam - can't be a negative number or equal to 0. if the num is 1 - just like before refactoring the big change/ refactor - instead of writing straight to the pixel with calculating by calcColor there, we will define a parameter color first at "black" and then will sum the amount of each ray into the parameter. at last we will divide by the sum of rays- an average. by that, each pixel will get it's color by the average of the color amount of the rays.

    • writeToImage

      public void writeToImage()
      a shell func that calls the "write to image" func through the _image-writer field

    • constructReflectedRay

      public Ray constructReflectedRay​(Point3D geopoint, Ray inRay, Vector n)
      calculating the reflected ray - very similar to the specular light calculation
      Parameters:
      geopoint - - the intersected point with its geometry
      inRay - - the ray
      n - - the normal to the point
      Returns:
      the reflected ray

    • constructRefractedRay

      Parameters:

      inRay - - thr ray from the light
      n - - the normal to the point
      Returns:
      the refracted ray
